definition: Wild Salmon Policy metric comparing generational average spawner abundance to COSEWIC criterion D1 thresholds.

Amber status implies caution in the management of the Conservation Unit. While a CU in the Amber zone should be at a low risk of loss, there will be a degree of lost production. Decisions about the conservation of CUs in the Amber zone will involve broader consideration of biological, social, and economic issues.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: In the cautious zone, decisions and strategies promote stock rebuilding to the healthy zone. The stock is considered to be in the “cautious zone” if the biomass, or its index, is higher than 40% of BMSY but lower than 80% of BMSY. In other words:  40% BMSY < Biomass < 80% BMSY.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Requirement to document precautionary harvest measures when a CU resides between the limit and upper stock reference points.
A group of fish sufficiently isolated from other groups that, if extirpated, is very unlikely to recolonize naturally within an acceptable timeframe.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.

definition: The Committee on the Status of Endangered Wildlife in Canada (COSEWIC) is an independent advisory panel to the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Canada that meets twice a year to assess the status of wildlife species at risk of extinction. Members are wildlife biology experts from academia, government, non-governmental organizations and the private sector responsible for designating wildlife species in danger of disappearing from Canada.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2003). COSEWIC - Committee on the Status of Endangered Wildlife in Canada. Available at cosewic.ca/index.php/en/ [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2003). COSEWIC - Committee on the Status of Endangered Wildlife in Canada. Available at cosewic.ca/index.php/en/ [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: In the critical zone, stock growth is promoted and removals are kept to the lowest possible level. The stock is considered to be in “the critical zone” if the mature biomass, or its index, is less than or equal to 40% of BMSY. In other words:  Biomass ≤ 40% BMSY.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Requirement to document how conservation units were included, excluded, or proxied during an assessment.

A category that applies when the available information is insufficient (a) to resolve a Wildlife Species' eligibility for assessment or (b) to permit an assessment of the Wildlife Species' risk of extinction.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A unit of Canadian biodiversity that is discrete and evolutionarily significant, where discrete means that there is currently very little transmission of heritable (cultural or genetic) information from other such units, and evolutionarily significant means that the unit harbors heritable adaptive traits or an evolutionary history not found elsewhere in Canada.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2023). COSEWIC guidelines for recognizing designatable units. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/reports/preparing-status-reports/guidelines-recognizing-designatable-units.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2023). COSEWIC guidelines for recognizing designatable units. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/reports/preparing-status-reports/guidelines-recognizing-designatable-units.html [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A Wildlife Species facing imminent extirpation or extinction.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A Wildlife Species that no longer exists.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A Wildlife Species that no longer exists in the wild in Canada, but exists elsewhere.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Social and economic considerations will tend to be the primary drivers for the management of Conservation Units in the Green zone, though ecosystem or other non-consumptive use values could also be considered.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: The scientific recommendation provided to fisheries managers on allowable levels of fish removals, derived from stock assessments, harvest control rules, and reference points. It reflects both the biological status of the stock and practical considerations such as ecosystem impacts, management measures, and market conditions. Harvest advice does not prescribe that the full allowable harvest must be taken, but rather defines the levels of harvest that are consistent with sustaining stock productivity and avoiding limit reference points.
definition_source: Forrest, R. E., Holt, K. R., & Kronlund, A. R. (2018). Performance of alternative harvest control rules for two Pacific groundfish stocks with uncertain natural mortality: Bias, robustness and trade-offs. Fisheries Research, 206, p. 259-286.
definition_source_text: Forrest, R. E., Holt, K. R., & Kronlund, A. R. (2018). Performance of alternative harvest control rules for two Pacific groundfish stocks with uncertain natural mortality: Bias, robustness and trade-offs. Fisheries Research, 206, p. 259-286.

definition: In the healthy zone, the fish stock status is good, and fisheries management decisions and harvest strategies are designed to maintain fish stocks within this zone. The stock is considered to be “healthy” if the biomass, or its index, is higher than 80% of BMSY. In other words:  Biomass ≥ 80% BMSY.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Rapid status confidence category indicating that high-quality abundance metrics support the result.
Wild Salmon Policy metric comparing current generational average to long-term average spawner abundance.
Rapid status confidence category indicating limited supporting data (for example, derived from trend metrics alone).
Rapid status confidence category indicating mixed evidence or reliance on trend metrics supplemented by some abundance information.
Requirement to justify the absence of genetic stock identification or explain apportionment methods for mixed-stock fisheries.
A Wildlife Species that has been evaluated and found to be not at risk of extinction given the current circumstances.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Wild Salmon Policy metric quantifying linear change in spawner abundance over the most recent three generations.

When used in an advisory context in support of decision-making by the Government of Canada, this term conveys the sense that the advice is provided in situations of high scientific uncertainty. It is intended to promote actions that would result in a low probability of harm that is serious or difficult to reverse.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.

definition: Rebuilding plans are standalone documents specifically intended to address statutory requirements under the 2019 amendments to the Fisheries Act for the prescribed major fish stock subject to the Fish Stocks provisions (FSP). The obligation to develop and implement a rebuilding plan is triggered when a stock declines to, or below, its LRP. A rebuilding plan for a prescribed major fish stock must be developed within 24 months of the day on which the Minister first has knowledge the stock has declined to or below its LRP. If a stock is at or below its LRP when it is prescribed under the FSP, the 24-month timeline to develop a rebuilding plan for the stock starts the day the stock is prescribed in regulation. The approved plan must be published on DFO’s website. The plan should be published within 120 days from the date of the plan’s approval by the Minister.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2022). Guidelines for writing rebuilding plans per the Fish Stocks Provisions and A Fishery Decision-making Framework Incorporating the Precautionary Approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precautionary-precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2022). Guidelines for writing rebuilding plans per the Fish Stocks Provisions and A Fishery Decision-making Framework Incorporating the Precautionary Approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precautionary-precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Requirement to summarize rebuilding obligations and reference the relevant plan when a CU is at or below its limit reference point.

A Conservation Unit in the Red zone is undesirable because of the risk of extirpation, and the loss of ecological benefits and salmon production. Changes in status will trigger management actions that will vary depending on species, geographic regions, and cause of the decline.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2021). Wild Salmon Policy 2018-2022 Implementation Plan. Available at https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/40728109.pdf.

definition: Wild Salmon Policy metric comparing generational average spawner abundance to CU-specific benchmarks (for example Sgen or 80% SMSY).

An information-defined grouping of fish populations used for reporting, conservation assessment, or management purposes. Examples include Conservation Units (CUs), Stock Management Units (MUs), and Designatable Units (DUs).
Genetic reporting unit (repunit) used in GSI outputs.
A high-level obligation or check that applies when associated triggers hold (for example, summarizing rebuilding actions when a CU is below its limit reference point).
A Wildlife Species that may become threatened or endangered because of a combination of biological characteristics and identified threats.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A collection of stocks that are managed together with a joint stock status.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2024). Introduction to Stock Assessment - Glossary. https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/science/species-especes/fisheries-halieutiques/assessment-evaluation/glossary-glossaire/index-eng.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: A Wildlife Species that is likely to become an endangered if nothing is done to reverse the factors leading to its extirpation or extinction.
definition_source: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: COSEWIC. (2021). COSEWIC - Status categories. Available at https://cosewic.ca/index.php/en/assessment-process/cosewic-assessment-process-categories-and-guidelines/status-categories.html. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: For stocks that have an uncertain status, the uncertainty is factored into harvest level decisions. Greater uncertainty leads to more precautionary harvest levels.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2009). A fishery decision-making framework incorporating the precautionary approach. Available at https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/reports-rapports/regs/sff-cpd/precaution-eng.htm. [Accessed 09-10-2025].

definition: Requirement to record and communicate uncertainty considerations or data gaps associated with an assessment.

Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon is a framework designed to restore and maintain healthy and diverse salmon populations and their habitats for the benefit of Canadians in perpetuity. It prioritizes conservation of wild salmon through identifying and managing conservation units (CUs) that reflect the genetic and geographic diversity of salmon populations, while incorporating habitat protection, ecosystem management, and sustainable fisheries practices.
definition_source: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.
definition_source_text: Fisheries and Oceans Canada. (2005). Canada's Policy for Conservation of Wild Pacific Salmon. Retrieved from https://waves-vagues.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/library-bibliotheque/315577.pdf.

definition: Since CU status evaluations can include more than one metric, it is possible that different metrics could each indicate a different WSP status zone. A final step that synthesizes all metric and status-related information into an integrated status for each CU, and provides expert commentary on this information, is necessary as inputs into subsequent implementation of WSP Strategy 4 (Integrated Strategic Planning) to prioritize assessment activities and management actions .
definition_source: DFO. (2016). Integrated Biological Status of Southern British Columbia Chinook Salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha) Under the Wild Salmon Policy. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2016/042
definition_source_text: DFO. (2016). Integrated Biological Status of Southern British Columbia Chinook Salmon (Oncorhynchus tshawytscha) Under the Wild Salmon Policy. DFO Can. Sci. Advis. Sec. Sci. Advis. Rep. 2016/042
related_terms: Wild Salmon Policy biological status zone (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#WSPBiologicalStatusZone]

definition: The WSP rapid status assessment approach builds on previously completed WSP integrated status assessments. The detailed WSP integrated assessments are labour intensive, taking 10-40 experts up to three days to complete for each group of CUs. For this reason, assessments have only been completed for ~11% of the 377 current Pacific Salmon CUs, many of which are outdated. The WSP rapid approach can fill gaps by expanding coverage of CU statuses across time, species, and geographic areas. The WSP rapid status approach ensures statuses are scientifically objective, consistent, and comparable across BC/Yukon CUs. This approach is also relatively easy to implement, applicable to data rich and data poor CUs, and can be updated annually.
definition_source: Pestal, G., MacDonald, B. L., Grant, S. C. H., and Holt, C. A. (2023). State of the Salmon: rapid status assessment approach for Pacific salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. Can. Tech. Rep. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 3570: xiv + 200 p.
definition_source_text: Pestal, G., MacDonald, B. L., Grant, S. C. H., and Holt, C. A. (2023). State of the Salmon: rapid status assessment approach for Pacific salmon under Canada’s Wild Salmon Policy. Can. Tech. Rep. Fish. Aquat. Sci. 3570: xiv + 200 p.
related_terms: Wild Salmon Policy biological status zone (subClassOf) [https://w3id.org/dfoc/salmon#WSPBiologicalStatusZone]
